content.description: Fun Slab rock with a lot of different routes and variations, start near the right of the slab on top for an easier ~V0 climb  or start underneath the slab face near the left and climb over the edge up on to the slab for a more challenging start and slab climb.
content.protection: Pads and spotter strongly recommended, there's a few large rocks and a slight runout below the slab which could rough you up if you fall the right way.
content.location: Large slab rock  sticking up out of nowhere about 30 feet away from F*** you! if you're walking away from the cliff face.

content.description: Fun boulder on a lot of solid Jugs, a few sloper and crimp type holds but relatively easy with good feet all the way up with lots of variations. Start either on the left side of the boulder near the corner and traverse around the corner and up the face. or start lower on the face of the boulder and climb straight up.
content.protection: Pads and spotter recommended, once you around the corner this boulder goes pretty high and topping out can be a little scary if you don't have good footing.
content.location: About 50 feet to the right of F*** you!, if you walk away from the cliff face along the smaller rock ledge you'll run straight into this boulder.

content.description: Really fun low Hanging line to practice your heel hooks on. Start with your hands in on the ledge near the corner hook your heel, the start making moves up to the left, until you get to the corner/peak of the boulder then just climb up and push yourself over the top. Footwork is the key on this so you don't slip off and touch the ground because of how low the line is
content.protection: Maybe Pads or a spotter but its a very low route with lots of leaves to fall on, just make sure to kick any rocks or pointy sticks out of the way before you climb and you should be fine.
content.location: If you're walking from F*** You! walk to the right of Low Exposure about 30 feet past down into a small gulley with the boulder facing you.

content.description: Fun line, lots of good options for holds, start on the big flaky jug below the namesake graffiti, make a few of the harder moves up to the big horizontal crack then traverse around the corner and continue to traverse/climb and top out just left of the large metal pole sticking out of the rock.
content.protection: Pads and Spotter recommended, not a far fall and easy to bail off of if you get tired.
content.location: If you walk across the top of the cliff in front of the star and enter the words right where the cliff fence ends, you'll see a small valley in the rocks, climb/jump down that walk the top path that goes around the front of the cliff until you see the namesake F*** you graffitti with the burger and shake next to it.

content.description: Short, fun problem requiring only a few moves. Start with one hand on a small ledge next to the middle crack(yellow circle in the picture) and feet on the rock. Make a few moves as you go up the crack and top out at the top of the crack by the piece of a metal pole.
content.protection: Pads and spotter not necessarily needed as it isn't too tall and there's decent landing spot, but recommended.
content.location: Wall directly to the left of Low Exposure, 15 feet to the right of F*** You. Flat rock with a distinctive crack down the middle that goes up to the top.

content.description: Nice Shaded Spot on the side of Gibbons park (the cliff with the star) With plenty of unexplored boulders and walls to play around on. The rock in the bouldering area is relatively solid but climbers should still be wary for loose flakes. The closer you get to the bottom of the main cliff face the more loose flakes you will encounter as these walls aren't frequented as often. Pads and a Spotter are recommended as there are some dicey run-outs but there are a lot of lowball boulders and easier routes without much risk of falling if you don't feel like bringing up pads for a full day.
